org.spongepowered.api.entity.player

Interface Player

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ArmorEquipable, Carrier, CommandSource, CompositeValueStore<DataHolder,DataManipulator<?,?>>, DataHolder, DataSerializable, Entity, Equipable, Human, Identifiable, Living, LocatedSource, ProjectileSource, RemoteSource, Subject, Tamer, User, ValueContainer<DataHolder>, Viewer

    public interface Player
extends Human, User, LocatedSource, RemoteSource, Viewer
    A Player represents the in-game entity of a human playing on a server. This is in contrast to User which represents the storage and data associated with a Player.

    Any methods called on Player that are not on User do not store any data that persists across server restarts.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.spongepowered.api.entity.projectile.source.ProjectileSource

      • getJoinData

        JoinData getJoinData()
        Gets a copy of the current JoinData.

        Since a Player is already online, it means that the player has joined the server at least once, meaning there is a guaranteed initial join Date. Users may not have ever joined a server before.

        Returns:
        A copy of the join data

      • isSleepingIgnored

        boolean isSleepingIgnored()
        Gets whether this Player will be ignored when checking whether to skip the night due to players sleeping. The time in a world will be advanced to day if all players in it either are sleeping or have this tag.
        Returns:
        Whether this Player will be ignored when checking whether to skip the night

      • setSleepingIgnored

        void setSleepingIgnored(boolean sleepingIgnored)
        Sets whether this Player will be ignored when checking whether to skip the night due to players sleeping. The time in a world will be advanced to day if all players in it either are sleeping or have this tag.
        Parameters:
        sleepingIgnored - Whether this Player will be ignored when checking whether to skip the night
